subject: Creativity
title: Kind of Blue: How Miles Davis Reinvented Jazz
description: One-minute skill: Kind of Blue: How Miles Davis Reinvented Jazz.

hook.text: Miles Davis handed his band a few modal scales and said 'Play.' No rehearsal, no written parts. Kind of Blue was born.

buildup.text: Before Kind of Blue, jazz was based on complex chord changes.

discovery.text: Modal jazz replaced 'what notes can I play?' with 'what mood can I create?

twist.text: Nearly every track was a first take. The spontaneity wasn't a compromise â€” it was the artistic concept itself.

climax.text: Kind of Blue became the best-selling jazz album of all time â€” over 5 million copies. Simplicity outsold complexity.

punchline.text: Davis gave musicians less and got more. That's creative leadership.

quiz.question: What made Kind of Blue revolutionary in jazz?
options: Shifting from chord-based to modal (scale-based) improvisation
